messages: 0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (16:22): bugmail: [Bug 8447] Tighter definition on the aside element <http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-bugzilla/2009Dec/0068.html> ** [Bug 8451] New: "The q element uses the HTMLQuoteElement interface." - say "Uses HTMLQuoteElement." instead, for consistency with "Uses HTMLElement." <http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-bugzilla/2009Dec/0067.html>
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:25): sure
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (16:25): did we ever discuss whether XHR needs to say something about how to translate header field values...
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (16:25): ...from the wite (octet sequence) to Javascript characters (and vice versa)?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:26): only for sending
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (16:27): or are you saying it was dicussed, but not done...?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:28): there's no translation
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:28): basically invalid values are ignored
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:28): no escape syntax is used
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:28): i guess we could consider it for a future version, maybe
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (16:28): what's the definition of valid in this context?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:29): some rfc2616 grammar rule
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:29): read the spec
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (16:30): RFC 2616 doesn't really say, that's the problem.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:31): meh, it's not exactly "valid"
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:31): it's something else
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:32): header-value production or some such
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:32): anyway, it's all there quite clearly spelled out
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:32): i guess i should've said i'm away, sorry :)
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (16:33): the reference to field-value in RFC 2616 doesn't help
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (16:33): because that's in term of octets, not characters
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (16:34): you still need to define how to get from Javascript characters to octets
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:36): i suppose
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:36): the idea is that field-value specifies the allowed ascii-characters
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:36): but I guess everything could be slightly more explicit
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:37): (it has been implemented in that way so it wasn't much of a problem apparently)
60659cfda992013e610f285c46692d28 (16:39): I assume the implementations use ISO-8859-1 but that should probably be tested
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:46): pretty clear that nobody actually reads documents anymore
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:46): it's quite clearly spelled out that we want comments to start with [xhr] in the subject but I believe nobody has done that so far
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (16:48): Shouldn't document things that conflict with what occurs in practice
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:53): hard to predict what happens in practice
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (16:54): It's easy to predict people won't read documents :-)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:54): I think everybody always assumes that part of the document is old or ignored by everyone else
07fcaaf58d082d22890ac01335710952 (17:17): I believe, excuse me to interfere, but we have the Wiki's for tackling this sort of troubles
07fcaaf58d082d22890ac01335710952 (17:20): why should I read an article where I can follow my instincts or customs very well - anonymous saying not mine :)

07fcaaf58d082d22890ac01335710952 (17:22): thanks to the greed in human nature, or should I have said that in the animals, after years of ignorance it is only NOW that (SERP competition) people "reads about" and "cares about" what they are coding, how they are "mark-up" 'ing their web content

0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (17:23): bugmail: "[Bug 8449] Remove extraneous material from Table section" (2 messages in thread) <http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-html-bugzilla/2009Dec/0070.html>
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (17:23): 07fcaaf58d082d22890ac01335710952, this is not about that
